data.title: Elections: Lithuanian Presidency 2003 Round 2
data.text:
At stake in this election:

The office of President of Lithuania

Description of government structure:

Chief of State: President Valdas ADAMKUS

Head of Government: Premier Algirdas Mykolas BRAZAUSKAS

Assembly: Lithuania has a unicameral Parliament (Seimas) with 141 seats.

Description of electoral system:

The President is elected by popular vote to serve a 5-year term.

In the Parliament (Seimas), 70 members are elected by proportional representation and 71 members are elected by direct popular vote.

Main Candidates in the Second Round of the Presidential race:

Rolandas PAKSAS

Party: Liberal Democratic Party (LDP)

Valdas ADAMKUS

Party: Independent

Main Candidates in the First Round of the Presidential race:

Valdas ADAMKUS*

Party: Independent

*Rolandas PAKSAS

Party: Liberal Democratic Party (LDP)

Arturas PAULAUKAS

Party: New Union

Vytautas SERENAS

Party: Independent

Vytenis Povilas ANDRIUKAITIS

Party: Social Democratic Party (LSDP)

Kazimira Danute PRUNSKIENE

Party: Union of Peasants and New Democracy Union (VNDPU)

Other Candidates

Party: N/A

* ADAMKUS and PAKSAS will contest the second round of January 5, 2003.

Last Presidential election:

Last presidential election was held on January 4, 1998. President ADAMKUS won by securing 50.4% of the votes against PAULAUKAS, who had 49.6% of the valid votes.

Population and number of registered voters:

Population: 3,443,067 (2002)

Registered Voters: 2,272,805 (2003)

Gender Data:

· Female Population: 1,835,261 (2002)

· Is Lithuania a signatory to CEDAW: N/A

· Has Lithuania ratified CEDAW: Yes, accession (18 January 1994)

· Gender Quota: No

· Female candidates in this election: Yes

· Number of Female Parliamentarians: 15 (following the 2000 elections)

· Human Development Index Position: 37 (2014)

· Social Institutions and Gender Index (SIGI) Categorization: Low (2014)

Disability Data:

· Is Lithuania a signatory to CRPD: Yes (30 March 2007)

· Has Lithuania ratified CRPD: Yes (18 August 2010)

· Population with a disability: 516,460 (est.)
